result.execSummary:
The defendant Dwight D Ragland was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Dwight D Ragland is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Dwight D Ragland was found guilty of Homicide by Intoxicated Use of Vehicle, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.09(1)(a).
  • Dwight D Ragland was found guilty of Homicide by Intoxicated Use of Vehicle, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.09(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
PAY RESTITUTION IN THE AMOUNTS OF:  $500.00 payable to Milwaukee County Burial Assistance:  $1,885.00 payable to victim Deshon T.'s mother Daphanie W. to be paid first; $2,000.00 payable to Crime Victim Compensation;  $1,000.00 payable to State of Wisconsin Health and Human Services; and $730.00 payable to victim Krystal H.'s mother Alicia H. to be paid first.
Court ordered that restitution to the victim's mothers are to be paid first.
ALL RESTITUTION:  The Court ordered that restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
*1/10/2019  Order Amending Judgment of Conviction:  judgment of conviction shall reflect that restitution has been satisfied by settlement with respect to Daphanie W. and to Alicia H. and the Clerk's office shall modify the assessments accordingly.  The amounts remaining under the original restitution  order and subject to payment are:  (1) $500 payable to Milwaukee County Burial Assistance and (2) $1,000.00 payable to State of Wisconsin Health and Human Services.

EACH COUNT: Provide a DNA sample (unless previously done) and PAY DNA surcharge.  PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges.  The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* Court "administratively" ordered that the cash bail on deposit be assigned to Attorney Michael Hart for payment of defendant's attorney fees.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to count 3.  Credit given for 3 days time served.

superMiscConds.notes: Comply with the standard rules of extended supervision.

Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

**MATTER HEARD BY JUDGE CONEN FOR JUDGE DONALD.....
No appearances.

Court held off the record discussions with Attorney Michael Hart and ADA Grant Huebner.

ON THE RECORD.....
Per the off-the-record discussions with the attorneys, Court ordered the cash bail on deposit from both remitters of $2,500.00 and $5,000.00 = $7,500.00 to be assigned to Attorney Michael Hart, Bar# 1001528.
Attorney paper work dropped off.

(2) Restitution Worksheets filed by ADA Grant Huebner on behalf of the State.

**MATTER HEARD BY JUDGE CONEN FOR JUDGE DONALD.....
Defendant Dwight D Ragland in court with attorney Michael Hart.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

  Sentencing proceeds.  No changes made to PSI.  Statements made by the State, defense and defendant. Additional statements made by Daphanie W., Glen T., Alicia H., Kapri H., Lavina M., Peggy C., Janeen B.-P., and Pastor Timothy S. Jr.
.
AS TO COUNT 1:  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 8 YEARS, consecutive to Count 3.  
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 4 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 4 YEARS.
Credit given for 3 days time served.

AS TO COUNT 3:  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 8 YEARS, consecutive to Count 1.  
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 4 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 4 YEARS.
Credit given for ZERO days time served.

Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION (AS TO COUNTS 1 & 3):
* Comply with the standard rules of extended supervision.
* Perform 350 hours of community service.
* No possession of illegal substances.
* Maintain gainful employment.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges.  The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* Provide a DNA sample (unless previously done) and PAY DNA surcharge.  The Court ordered that the DNA surcharge be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* PAY restitution in the amount of $500.00 payable to Milwaukee County Burial Assistance.  The Court ordered that restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* PAY restitution in the amount of $1,885.00 payable to victim Deshon T.'s mother, Daphanie W.  The Court ordered that restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.  THIS IS TO BE PAID FIRST.
* PAY restitution in the amount of $2,000.00 payable to Crime Victim Compensation.  The Court ordered that restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* PAY restitution in the amount of $1,000.00 payable to State of Wisconsin Health and Human Services.  The Court ordered that restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* PAY restitution in the amount of $730.00 payable to victim Krystal H.'s mother, Alicia H.  The Court ordered that restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.  THIS IS TO BE PAID FIRST.

OTHER COURT ORDERS:
* Court ordered that restitution to the victims' mothers are to be paid first.

SPECIAL ORDER:
* Court "administratively" ordered that the cash bail on deposit be assigned to Attorney Michael Hart for payment of defendant's attorney fees.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given.

Filed:
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.

ADA Grant Huebner and Attorney Michael Hart appeared before the clerk today to request to reschedule 03-24-2016's at 9:00 AM Sentencing Hearing. 
PER THE PERMISSION OF JUDGE DONALD, CLERK RESCHEDULED THIS MATTER OFF THE RECORD.
Case rescheduled to 05-12-2016 at 1:30 PM for Adjourned Sentencing Hearing.

- NO FILE IN COURT -
Attorney Michael Hart in court, defendant Dwight D Ragland not in court, in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm for Grant Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties in court on a WALK-IN basis to adjourn 02-25-2016's Sentencing Hearing date.
Defendant is scheduled to have surgery soon.
Statements made.
Court rescheduled the 02-25-2016 at 1:30 PM Sentencing Hearing date to 03-24-2016 at 9:00 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court.
SUPPLEMENTAL DOCUMENTS IN SUPPORT filed by Atty. Michael Hart on behalf of the defendant.
Documents in Support of Defense's Sentencing Arguments filed by Atty. Michael Hart on behalf of the defendant.

Defendant Dwight D Ragland in court with attorney Michael Hart.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNTS 1 & 3:   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

Upon State's motion and pursuant to negotiations, Court ordered Count #2 and Count #4 dismissed outright.

**Court ordered a PSI with a recommendation.

Conditions of bail remain the same.

Case adjourned to 02-25-2016 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Sentencing Hearing.
